Documentation, FAQ, and troubleshooting for FlashFusion Unified

Dashboard Agents Workflows Integrations Help

Frequently Asked Questions

What is FlashFusion Unified?

FlashFusion Unified is an AI-powered business operating system that automates revenue streams across multiple business domains. It features 6 Universal Agents and 4 core workflow types to transform business ideas into automated processes.

How do Universal Agents work?

Universal Agents are AI-powered entities that can adapt to different business contexts:

  • Researcher: Gathers market intelligence and data
  • Creator: Generates content, designs, and assets
  • Optimizer: Improves performance and conversions
  • Automator: Sets up and manages automated processes
  • Analyzer: Provides insights and analytics
  • Coordinator: Manages inter-agent communication

What are the 4 workflow types?

FlashFusion supports four core workflow types:

  • Development: MVP creation, testing, deployment automation
  • Commerce: Multi-platform e-commerce optimization
  • Content: Content creation and distribution automation
  • Hybrid: Cross-workflow orchestration and optimization

How do I rename an agent?

To rename an agent:

  1. Go to the Agents page
  2. Click on the agent card you want to rename
  3. Click the "Edit" button
  4. Change the "Agent Name" field
  5. Click "Save Changes"

How do I change workflow hierarchy?

To manage workflow execution order:

  1. Navigate to Workflows ‚Üí Hierarchy tab
  2. Drag and drop workflows to reorder them
  3. Higher position = higher priority
  4. Click "Save Order" to apply changes

How do I export/import configurations?

FlashFusion supports configuration backup and restore:

  • Export: Use export buttons on any management page
  • Import: Use import buttons to restore configurations
  • Formats: JSON for configurations, CSV for data
  • Scope: Per-component or full system export

Troubleshooting Guide

üîß Common Issues

Agents not responding to chat

Symptoms: Agent chat returns errors or no response

Solutions:

  1. Check if agents are initialized: Go to /health endpoint
  2. Verify API endpoints are working: Test /api/v1/agents
  3. Restart the platform if agents show as "not ready"
  4. Check browser console for JavaScript errors
Workflows failing to start

Symptoms: Workflows stuck in "created" status

Solutions:

  1. Ensure required agents are available and idle
  2. Check workflow engine health: /api/v1/status
  3. Verify workflow configuration is valid
  4. Review workflow logs for specific errors
Integration connection failures

Symptoms: External services showing as disconnected

Solutions:

  1. Verify API keys are correctly configured in .env
  2. Check service status pages for outages
  3. Test individual connections using test buttons
  4. Review rate limits and usage quotas
Dashboard pages not loading

Symptoms: White screens or 404 errors on subpages

Solutions:

  1. Clear browser cache and refresh
  2. Check if server is running: curl localhost:3333/health
  3. Verify static files are served correctly
  4. Check browser developer tools for network errors

üö® Error Codes

FF001: Agent initialization failed

One or more agents failed to initialize. Check agent configurations and restart.

FF002: Workflow execution timeout

Workflow took too long to complete. Check step configurations and agent availability.

FF003: Integration authentication error

External service authentication failed. Verify API keys and permissions.

FF004: Resource limit exceeded

Platform resource limits reached. Consider upgrading or optimizing usage.

API Documentation

üîó Base URL

http://localhost:3333/api/v1

ü§ñ Agent Endpoints

GET /agents - List all agents 
Response: { success: true, data: { agents: [...] } }
GET /agents/:id - Get specific agent 
Response: { success: true, data: { id, name, status, ... } }
POST /agents/chat - Chat with agent 
Body: { agentId: "coordinator", message: "Hello", context: {} }

‚öôÔ∏è Workflow Endpoints

GET /workflows - List all workflows 
Response: { success: true, data: { workflows: [...] } }
POST /workflows - Create workflow 
Body: { type: "development", config: { name: "Test" } }
POST /workflows/:id/start - Start workflow 
Response: { success: true, data: { workflowId, status } }
